snippet: Despite efforts by President Obama to win the Indian prime minister’s cooperation on reducing harmful emissions, India’s negotiators have so far staked out an uncompromising position.
abstract: India's Prime Min Narendra Modi emerges as pivotal player at world climate talks in Paris, potentially forming outcome of agreement that Pres Obama wants to build legacy on; India, world's third-biggest polluter, says it is entitled to increase fossil fuel use as growing third-world power or get billions of dollars to help switch to cleaner energy.

byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Coral Davenport reported from Le Bourget, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Despite efforts by President Obama to win the Indian prime minister’s cooperation on reducing harmful emissions, India’s negotiators have so far staked out an uncompromising position.

headline.main: Narendra Modi Could Make or Break Obama’s Climate Legacy
headline.print_headline: India Emerges as Key Player in Paris Talks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
